articles.description: Children with cancer are no more vulnerable than other children to COVID-19 infection or morbidity resulting from the disease, according to a study. The study, published in JAMA Oncology, found that of all the children with cancer infected with COVID-19, 95 p…
articles.content:
Children with cancer are no more vulnerable than other children to COVID-19 infection or morbidity resulting from the disease, according to a study.
The study, published in JAMA Oncology, found that of all the children with cancer infected with COVID-19, 95 … [+2132 chars]

articles.author: John Paul Ging
articles.title: Coronavirus: New gene research aims to identify those most at risk from COVID-19 - Euronews
articles.description: A new genetic research project aims to identify and ultimately protect those most at risk from the current and potential future waves of COVID-19
articles.content:
Researchers in the UK are hoping to discover why COVID-19 affects some people much more strongly than others.
It is hoped it could lead to isolating those at higher risk in potential future waves of the disease and allowing those identified as low-risk to re… [+2010 chars]

articles.author: Pinkvilla Desk
articles.title: Weight Loss: Follow THESE tips that are backed by research to shed extra kilos - PINKVILLA
articles.description: There is a lot of misinformation on the web on weight loss. And that's why follow weight loss tips that are backed by research.

articles.title: East Tennessee Children's Hospital: 2 may have illness related to COVID-19 - WBIR Channel 10
articles.description: There is no confirmation these two children have the illness. Symptoms include persistent fever, rash, abdominal pain and vomiting.
